concept.title: Livefyre iOS SDK
concept.shortdesc: Add Livefyre to your native iOS App.

conbody.p: Use this open-source library to integrate Livefyre services into your native iOS app. The Livefyre StreamHub iOS SDK provides a thin layer around our common API mechanisms, based on the excellent AFNetworking library.
Livefyre also provides two iOS Sample Apps based on this SDK: a Comment Stream and a Reviews sample App.

section.title: As an Xcode subproject
section.p: Next, add the Xcode project (LFSClient.xcodeproj) to your app as a subproject (easily done by simply dragging the LFSClient.xcodeproj file into Project Navigator pane in Xcode).
You will also need to do the same with any of the dependencies (AFNetworking, JSONKit).

section.title: Download everything at once (not recommended)
section.codeblock: cd ~/dev git clone https://github.com/Livefyre/StreamHub-iOS-SDK.git cd StreamHub-iOS-SDK git submodule init git submodule update pod repo add livefyre https://github.com/Livefyre/cocoapods.git pod install cd examples/CommentStream pod install open CommentStream.xcworkspace
section.note: To run tests in Xcode 6, you must add $(PLATFORM_DIR)/Developer/Library/Frameworks to FRAMEWORK_SEARCH_PATHS in Pods-test-XCTest+OHHTTPStubSuiteCleanUp pod [http://stackoverflow.com/a/24651704].
section.p: You need LFSTestConfig.plist file from Livefyre, which Livefyre provides upon request.

section.title: Xcode Documentation
section.p: You can browse the documentation or you can build the “Documentation” target in your Xcode (requires appledoc to be installed) on your system.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: StreamHub iOS SDK versions since v0.2.0 require iOS 6.0 or higher.

section.title: Appendix (JSON support)
section.p: For those looking at StreamHub-iOS SDK internals, please note that we use a modified version of JSONKit as the default JSON parser (instead of Apple-provided NSJSONSerialization). We had to do this because the Apple-provided parser does not support decoding JSON files that contain integers or floating point numbers that are larger than those that can be represented by the system. Our modified version of JSONKit truncates very large numbers to corresponding system maximum, instead of throwing an exception.
